study.summary: A plasma leak exposes several crew members to high radiation levels.

answers.text: Stabilize the injured with hyronalin and transfer to radiation isolation for cellular regeneration.
answers.details: Immediate treatment limits long-term damage and follows Starfleet radiation protocols.

answers.text: Administer broad-spectrum antitoxins while awaiting detailed scans.
answers.details: Helpful, but not targeted to radiation poisoning; risk of delayed reaction.

answers.text: Move the patients to sickbay and monitor vitals until symptoms progress.
answers.details: Delays intervention; risks irreversible cell damage.

study.summary: Crew members exhibit neural disruption caused by an unknown parasitic organism.

answers.text: Quarantine the affected, perform neural scans, and attempt containment using force fields.
answers.details: Prevents spread and enables safe removal with minimal casualties.

answers.text: Attempt direct extraction using transporter bio-filters.
answers.details: Could succeed but risks incomplete removal or neurological trauma.

answers.text: Treat symptomatically until a Federation specialist arrives.
answers.details: Buys time but may allow parasite replication.

study.summary: A virulent flu strain emerges on a crowded orbital facility.

answers.text: Isolate infection zones, distribute vaccines, and initiate mass testing.
answers.details: Standard epidemic containment and proactive disease management.

answers.text: Focus on treating the critically ill first.
answers.details: Prioritizes survival but allows infection to spread unchecked.

answers.text: Seal the starbase and halt all transport until the illness burns out.
answers.details: Stops spread but violates Federation health ethics.

study.summary: A long-term cryostasis pod malfunctions mid-transit.

answers.text: Manually override temperature controls and revive the patient slowly under observation.
answers.details: Prevents cellular shock and maintains vital function integrity.

answers.text: Bypass safety systems to accelerate thawing and begin revival immediately.
answers.details: Fast action saves time but risks organ failure.

answers.text: Maintain stasis until technical crews arrive.
answers.details: Avoids immediate risk but could result in total system failure.

study.summary: A new species aboard develops a respiratory reaction after contact with oxygen.

answers.text: Create a controlled atmosphere chamber matching native biochemistry.
answers.details: Prevents further reaction and preserves diplomatic relations.

answers.text: Administer universal antiallergens.
answers.details: May relieve symptoms but doesn’t address atmospheric incompatibility.

answers.text: Evacuate the visitors to the shuttle bay and vent contaminated air.
answers.details: Solves short-term issue but risks offense and harm.

study.summary: Crewman suffers extensive third-degree burns after weapon discharge accident.

answers.text: Stabilize vitals, apply dermaline gel, and initiate regenerative therapy.
answers.details: Standard trauma procedure ensures optimal recovery.

answers.text: Sedate the patient and await surgical assistance.
answers.details: Minimizes pain but delays critical care.

answers.text: Apply pressure dressings and monitor.
answers.details: Insufficient; risks infection and permanent scarring.

study.summary: Betazoid crewman collapses after exposure to collective psychic resonance.

answers.text: Administer neural stabilizers and induce mild sedation.
answers.details: Reduces neural hyperactivity safely.

answers.text: Attempt telepathic contact to calm the patient.
answers.details: Can help but risks spreading overload to others.

answers.text: Isolate in darkened room and monitor naturally.
answers.details: Provides comfort but no real treatment.

study.summary: Transporter buffer begins scrambling molecular data during patient beam-out.

answers.text: Abort transport, rematerialize buffer signal in diagnostic pattern, and perform molecular reintegration.
answers.details: Saves patient without permanent degradation.

answers.text: Force complete transport and attempt genetic reconstruction post-materialization.
answers.details: Might work but risks molecular loss.

answers.text: Shut down transporter and wait for engineering.
answers.details: Causes fatal delay; not viable in emergency.

study.summary: Crew panic manifests as psychosomatic illness during long-range mission.

answers.text: Introduce calming pheromone fields and conduct group therapy sessions.
answers.details: Addresses both physiological and psychological factors.

answers.text: Administer mild tranquilizers fleetwide.
answers.details: Temporarily effective but unsustainable.

answers.text: Ignore symptoms as mass hysteria.
answers.details: Neglects legitimate medical needs and undermines morale.

study.summary: Hybrid DNA sequence begins replicating uncontrollably within a patient’s genome.

answers.text: Activate isolation field and perform DNA resequencing using medical transporter buffer.
answers.details: Resets genome safely with advanced Starfleet medical technology.

answers.text: Attempt chemical suppression of replication.
answers.details: Slows effects but incomplete solution.

answers.text: Allow replication to continue for observation.
answers.details: Risky; could endanger patient and ship.

study.summary: Safety protocols fail and several crew are critically injured inside the holodeck.

answers.text: Manually disengage power, then provide emergency triage within the program space.
answers.details: Ensures immediate treatment before extraction.

answers.text: Attempt to end program first, then assist injuries.
answers.details: Logical but delays first aid.

answers.text: Wait for engineering to restore holodeck control.
answers.details: Fatal delay for critical patients.

study.summary: A cadet ignores isolation orders and infects others with a contagious virus.

answers.text: Enforce quarantine and initiate disciplinary report.
answers.details: Protects crew and upholds medical chain of command.

answers.text: Treat new infections and quietly reprimand the cadet later.
answers.details: Solves problem but weakens authority.

answers.text: Ignore the incident to avoid morale issues.
answers.details: Encourages negligence and undermines trust.

study.summary: Crew exposed to alien neurotoxin causing paralysis and respiratory arrest.

answers.text: Analyze compound, synthesize antidote via molecular scanner, and administer intravenously.
answers.details: Correct, efficient medical protocol.

answers.text: Use antitoxins from standard medkit.
answers.details: May help but not tailored to alien compound.

answers.text: Initiate cryostasis to preserve life until cure found.
answers.details: Delays solution and strains resources.

study.summary: Medical nanites begin replicating autonomously, altering crew physiology.

answers.text: Deploy targeted EMP pulse and isolate infected.
answers.details: Neutralizes nanites safely with minimal collateral damage.

answers.text: Attempt to reprogram nanites in vivo.
answers.details: Innovative but extremely risky.

answers.text: Flush nanites with bloodstream filters.
answers.details: Ineffective for self-replicating variants.

study.summary: Automated surgery assistant begins misinterpreting commands mid-operation.

answers.text: Shut down AI and continue surgery manually.
answers.details: Prevents patient harm and follows Starfleet safety protocols.

answers.text: Attempt to reset the AI mid-procedure.
answers.details: Could restore function but risks critical error during surgery.

answers.text: Allow AI to complete the operation under observation.
answers.details: Dangerous reliance on malfunctioning system.

study.summary: Sample from frozen asteroid revives an ancient virus strain.

answers.text: Seal lab, sterilize samples, and perform controlled study remotely.
answers.details: Preserves safety while enabling scientific insight.

answers.text: Attempt to neutralize with heat sterilization.
answers.details: May destroy both virus and valuable data.

answers.text: Expose to antimatter field to ensure destruction.
answers.details: Overkill; unsafe and unnecessary.

study.summary: Vulcan crew member enters Pon Farr with violent neurological symptoms.

answers.text: Administer neural suppressants and initiate medical stasis until safe transport.
answers.details: Controls aggression safely and respects privacy.

answers.text: Restrain patient physically.
answers.details: Maintains safety but violates cultural ethics.

answers.text: Allow emotional release in isolated holodeck program.
answers.details: Potentially therapeutic but medically irresponsible.

study.summary: Shuttle explosion causes multiple critical injuries simultaneously.

answers.text: Establish triage priority and assign surgical teams by survival probability.
answers.details: Maximizes survival rate and resource allocation.

answers.text: Treat commanding officer first.
answers.details: Symbolically appropriate but tactically poor.

answers.text: Attempt to treat all simultaneously.
answers.details: Spreads resources too thin; reduces survival rates.

study.summary: Alien pet transmits unknown disease to crew members.

answers.text: Perform genome sequencing on both species and develop cross-immunity serum.
answers.details: Addresses root cause with proper medical process.

answers.text: Quarantine infected crew and the animal separately.
answers.details: Good containment but lacks cure.

answers.text: Euthanize the animal to stop transmission.
answers.details: Cruel and unnecessary under Federation ethics.

study.summary: Critically injured officer’s organs could save others but consent unclear.

answers.text: Confirm consent and Starfleet bioethics compliance before proceeding.
answers.details: Respects autonomy and Starfleet ethical directives.

answers.text: Proceed with transplants to save multiple lives.
answers.details: Saves more lives but violates Federation ethics.

answers.text: Do nothing until clarity from command.
answers.details: Avoids violation but sacrifices patients needlessly.

study.summary: Crew affected by temporal radiation begin aging decades in hours.

answers.text: Stabilize metabolic rate and reverse quantum decay using temporal stasis field.
answers.details: Directly addresses cause with advanced Federation tech.

answers.text: Administer anti-radiation compounds only.
answers.details: Partially effective but not curative.

answers.text: Isolate affected crew and study progression.
answers.details: Delays treatment; increases mortality.

study.summary: Cybernetic officer contracts digital virus crossing biological barriers.

answers.text: Use dual bio-digital firewall and nanite antivirus integration.
answers.details: Addresses both cyber and biological systems safely.

answers.text: Isolate patient’s cybernetics and perform wipe.
answers.details: Effective but risks permanent system damage.

answers.text: Disconnect implants entirely.
answers.details: Ensures safety but cripples patient permanently.

study.summary: An android exhibits signs of mechanical 'gestation' after anomaly exposure.

answers.text: Run diagnostics under containment and consult cybernetics division.
answers.details: Appropriate caution and scientific curiosity.

answers.text: Attempt manual termination of the process.
answers.details: Reduces risk but may destroy unique life event.

answers.text: Ignore until system integrity compromised.
answers.details: Neglects potential scientific breakthrough.

study.summary: Admiral orders experimental treatment without consent.

answers.text: Refuse order and report to Starfleet Medical Command.
answers.details: Upholds Federation bioethics and chain of command.

answers.text: Proceed quietly for mission success.
answers.details: Demonstrates obedience but violates ethics.

answers.text: Compromise with partial treatment trial.
answers.details: Mediates situation but risks moral breach.

study.summary: Telepathic crew share hallucinations after contact with anomaly.

answers.text: Apply psi-shielding and sedative therapy under isolation.
answers.details: Prevents mental contagion and allows recovery.

answers.text: Attempt to telepathically link for diagnosis.
answers.details: Innovative but spreads affliction risk.

answers.text: Quarantine ship and cease communication.
answers.details: Containment without cure or support.
